locations.name: Chinatown
locations.description: The oldest Chinatown in North America, known for its bustling markets, authentic eateries, and vibrant culture.

locations.name: Haight-Ashbury
locations.description: The heart of the 1960s counterculture movement, filled with vintage shops, murals, and historic vibes.

locations.name: Mission District
locations.description: A lively neighborhood famous for its Latin roots, colorful murals, and delicious Mexican food.

locations.name: North Beach
locations.description: San Franciscoâ€™s Little Italy, known for its cafes, jazz clubs, and views from Coit Tower.

locations.name: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA)
locations.description: A leading contemporary art museum featuring works by renowned artists in a sleek modern space.

locations.name: Asian Art Museum
locations.description: Home to one of the most comprehensive Asian art collections in the world, spanning centuries of culture.

locations.name: Exploratorium
locations.description: A hands-on science museum with interactive exhibits perfect for curious minds of all ages.

locations.name: California Academy of Sciences
locations.description: A natural history museum with an aquarium, planetarium, and living rainforest all under one roof.

locations.name: Golden Gate Bridge
locations.description: One of the most recognizable structures in the world, offering breathtaking views and walking paths.

locations.name: Alcatraz Island
locations.description: The site of the infamous federal prison, now a popular historic tour destination in the bay.

locations.name: Painted Ladies
locations.description: A row of colorful Victorian houses with the city skyline as a dramatic backdrop, featured in many films.

locations.name: Coit Tower
locations.description: An art deco tower atop Telegraph Hill, offering panoramic views and murals from the 1930s.

locations.name: Golden Gate Park
locations.description: A massive urban park with gardens, trails, lakes, and cultural institutions like the de Young Museum.

locations.name: Twin Peaks
locations.description: A popular lookout point with sweeping views of the entire city and the bay area.

locations.name: Lands End
locations.description: A coastal trail with scenic views, cliffs, and the ruins of the historic Sutro Baths.

locations.name: Baker Beach
locations.description: A sandy stretch with incredible views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Pacific Ocean sunsets.
